trans-unit.source: Murach’s Structured COBOL

My familiarity with COBOL may be prejudicing my opinion, but it doesn’t appear to me that the Java code is any simpler than the COBOL code. In case you’re interested in character counts, the Java code comes in at 278 (not counting indentation characters). The COBOL code is 298 (274 without the IDENTIFICATION DIVISION. header).

My familiarity with COBOL may be prejudicing my opinion, but it doesn’t appear to me that the Java code is any simpler than the COBOL code. In case you’re interested in character counts, the Java code comes in at 278 (not counting indentation characters). The COBOL code is 298 (274 without theIDENTIFICATION DIVISION.header).
trans-unit.target: Возможно, мое знакомство с COBOL предвосхищает мое мнение, но мне не кажется, что код Java проще, чем код COBOL. Если вас интересует количество символов, код Java составляет 278 (не считая символов отступа). Код COBOL - 298 (274 без заголовка IDENTIFICATION DIVISION. ).

trans-unit.source: Not all GnuCOBOL implementations support file sharing and record-locking options. Whether they do or not depends upon the operating system they were built for and the build options that were used when the specific GnuCOBOL implementation was generated.

trans-unit.source: Not all GnuCOBOL implementations support locking. Whether they do or not depends upon the operating system they were built for and the build options that were used when GnuCOBOL was generated. When a program using one of those GnuCOBOL implementations issues an UNLOCK, it will ignored. There will be no compiler message issued. Buffer syncing, if needed, will still occur.
trans-unit.target: Не все внедрения GnuCOBOL поддерживают блокировку.Поддерживают они или нет,зависит от операционной системы,для которой они были собраны,и опций сборки,которые использовались при создании GnuCOBOL.Когда программа,использующая одну из этих реализаций GnuCOBOL,выдаёт UNLOCK,она игнорируется.Сообщения компилятора выдаваться не будут.Синхронизация буфера,если потребуется,все равно произойдет.

trans-unit.source: Not specifying an <

Not specifying an identifier-1 or FILLER immediately after the level number has the same effect as if FILLER were specified. A data item named FILLER cannot be referenced directly; these items are generally used to specify an unused portion of the total storage allocated to a group item or to describe a group item whose contents which will only be referenced using the names of those items that belong to it.

Not specifying an identifier-1 or FILLER immediately after the level number has the same effect as if FILLER were specified. A data item named FILLER cannot be referenced directly; these items are generally used to specify an unused portion of the total storage allocated to a group item or to describe a group item whose contents which will only be referenced using the names of those items that belong to it. In the linkage section, 01-level data items cannot be named FILLER.

Note how the cobcrun command does not allow a path to be specified with the program name — the directory in which the programs dynamically loadable module exists must either be the current directory or must be defined in the current PATH.
Note how the COBOL program ensures that a null end-of-string terminator is present on both string arguments.

trans-unit.source: Note that even though we told GnuCOBOL that the 1st argument was to be BY VALUE, it was treated as if it were BY REFERENCE anyway. String (char array) arguments passed from C callers to GnuCOBOL subprograms will be modifiable by the subprogram. It’s best to pass a copy of such data if you want to ensure that the subprogram doesn’t change it.

Note that even though we told GnuCOBOL that the 1st argument was to beBY VALUE it was treated as if it wereBY REFERENCEanyway. String (char array) arguments passed from C callers to GnuCOBOL subprograms will be modifiable by the subprogram. It’s best to pass a copy of such data if you want to ensure that the subprogram doesn’t change it.
trans-unit.target: Обратите внимание, что даже несмотря на то, что мы сказали GnuCOBOL, что 1-й аргумент должен быть BY VALUE ЗНАЧЕНИЮ, он все равно обрабатывался так, как если бы он был BY REFERENCE . Строковые (массив символов) аргументы, переданные от вызывающих C к подпрограммам GnuCOBOL, могут быть изменены подпрограммой. Лучше передать копию таких данных, если вы хотите убедиться, что подпрограмма не изменит их.

trans-unit.source: Numeric literals may be split across lines just as alphanumeric literals are, using either of the above techniques and both reserved and user-defined words can be split across lines too (using the first technique). The continuation of numeric literals and user-defined/reserved words is provided merely to provide compatibility with older COBOL versions and programs, but should not be used with new programs — it just makes for ugly-looking programs.
trans-unit.target: Числовые литералы могут быть разделены по строкам так же, как буквенно-цифровые литералы, используя любой из вышеперечисленных методов, и как зарезервированные, так и определяемые пользователем слова также могут быть разделены по строкам (с использованием первого метода). Продолжение числовых литералов и определяемых пользователем / зарезервированных слов предоставляется просто для обеспечения совместимости со старыми версиями и программами COBOL, но не должно использоваться с новыми программами - это просто делает программы некрасивыми.

On a UNIX system this means the programs may be executed from a command shell such as bash, csh, ksh and so forth. When a GnuCOBOL program runs on a Windows system, it runs within a console window (i.e.

On a UNIX system this means the programs may be executed from a command shell such as bash, csh, ksh and so forth. When a GnuCOBOL program runs on a Windows system, it runs within a console window (i.e. "cmd.exe"). OSX versions of GnuCOBOL programs run within a "terminal.app" window.
trans-unit.target: На UNIX системе это означает,что программы могут выполняться из командной оболочки,такой как bash,csh,ksh и так далее.Когда программа GnuCOBOL запускается в системе Windows,она запускается в консольном окне (т.е."cmd.exe").OSX-версии программ GnuCOBOL запускаются в окне "terminal.app".

trans-unit.source: On a Unix system, the shell environment will be established using the default shell program. This is also true when using a GnuCOBOL build created with and for OSX or the Cygwin Unix emulator.
trans-unit.target: В системе Unix окружение оболочки будет создано с помощью программы оболочки по умолчанию.Это также верно при использовании сборки GnuCOBOL,созданной с OSX и для OSX или эмулятора Cygwin Unix.

trans-unit.source: On a Windows system, the TMP environment variable is normally set for you when you logon. If you wish to use a different temporary folder, you may set TMPDIR yourself and have no fear of disrupting other Windows software that relies on TMP.

On a Windows system, theTMPenvironment variable is normally set for you when you logon. If you wish to use a different temporary folder, you may setTMPDIRyourself and have no fear of disrupting other Windows software that relies on TMP.
trans-unit.target: В системе Windows переменная среды TMP обычно устанавливается автоматически при входе в систему. Если вы хотите использовать другую временную папку, вы можете установить TMPDIR самостоятельно и не бояться нарушить работу другого программного обеспечения Windows, использующего TMP.

trans-unit.source: On a system supporting only one format of binary storage (generally, that would be big-endian), the terms

trans-unit.target: В системе, поддерживающей только один формат двоичного хранилища (обычно это прямой порядок байтов), термины «наиболее эффективный» и «собственный формат» являются синонимами.

trans-unit.source: Once GnuCOBOL programs have been compiled into either directly-executable programs (created via the

Once GnuCOBOL programs have been compiled into either directly-executable programs (created via the-xswitch) or dynamically-loadable libraries (created via the-mswitch), those programs may be executed from any shell environment. The exact manner in which the two are executed will differ, as described in the upcoming sections.
trans-unit.target: После того, как программы GnuCOBOL были скомпилированы либо в непосредственно исполняемые программы (созданные с помощью переключателя -x ), либо в динамически загружаемые библиотеки (созданные с помощью переключателя -m ), эти программы могут выполняться из любой среды оболочки. Точный способ их выполнения будет отличаться, как описано в следующих разделах.

trans-unit.source: Once a Format 1 REPLACE statement is encountered in the currently-compiling source file, Replace Mode becomes active, and the change(s) specified by that statement will be automatically made on all subsequent source statements the compiler reads from the file.

Once a Format 1REPLACEstatement is encountered in the currently-compiling source file, Replace Mode becomes active, and the change(s) specified by that statement will be automatically made on all subsequent source statements the compiler reads from the file.
trans-unit.target: Как только в текущем компилируемом исходном файле встречается оператор REPLACE формата 1, активируется режим замены, и изменения, указанные этим оператором, будут автоматически внесены во все последующие исходные операторы, которые компилятор считывает из файла.

trans-unit.source: Once a dynamically-loadable module is actually loaded into memory, even if it is subsequently unloaded (via the CANCEL statement), its list of entry-points remain available to the GnuCOBOL run-time library and subsequent re-executions of any of those entry points will be able to bypass the search (rule #4) as well as the

Once a dynamically-loadable module is actually loaded into memory, even if it is subsequently unloaded (via theCANCELstatement), it’s list of entry-points remain available to the GnuCOBOL run-time library and subsequent re-executions of any of those entry points will be able to bypass the search (rule #4) as well as the "first-execution rule" (rule #3).
trans-unit.target: После того, как динамически загружаемый модуль фактически загружен в память, даже если он впоследствии выгружается (с помощью оператора CANCEL ), его список точек входа остается доступным для библиотеки времени выполнения GnuCOBOL и последующего повторного выполнения любой из этих записей. точки смогут обойти поиск (правило №4), а также «правило первого выполнения» (правило №3).

Opening a file with this sharing option indicates you are willing to allow other programs to OPEN the file for input while you have it open. If they attempt any other OPEN, theirs will fail with a file status of 37. Of course, your program may fail if someone else got to the file first and opened it with a sharing option that imposed file-sharing limitations.

Packed-decimal (

Packed-decimal (i.e.USAGE PACKED-DECIMALUSAGE COMP-3orUSAGE COMP-6 data is stored as a series of bytes such that each byte contains two 4-bit fields, referred to as ’nibbles’ (since they comprise half a "byte", they’re just "nibbles" — don’t groan, I don’t just make this stuff up!). Each nibble represents a9in thePICTUREand each holds a single decimal digit encoded as its binary value (0 = 0000, 1 = 0001, … , 9 = 1001).
trans-unit.target: Упакованные десятичные (т. USAGE PACKED-DECIMAL USAGE COMP-3 или USAGE COMP-6 данные хранятся в виде последовательности байтов, так что каждый байт содержит два 4-битных поля, называемых полубайтами (поскольку они составляют половину " byte ", это просто" полубайты "- не стоните, я не просто придумываю это!). Каждый полубайт представляет собой 9 на PICTURE и каждый содержит одну десятичную цифру, закодированную как ее двоичное значение (0 = 0000, 1 = 0001,…, 9 = 1001).

trans-unit.source: Parenthesis provide for a recursive application of the arithmetic expression rules, effectively allowing you to alter the precedence of operations. 4 times 2 is 8 (the use of parenthesis "trumps" the exponentiation operator, so the multiplication happens first); 8 ^ 3 is 512, minus 10 is 502.
trans-unit.target: Репортезы предусматривают рекурсивное применение правил арифметических выражений,эффективно позволяя изменять приоритет операций.4 раза 2 равно 8 (использование скобок "козырь" оператора экспонентирования,поэтому умножение происходит первым);8 ^ 3 равно 512,минус 10 равно 502.

trans-unit.source: Parenthesis provide for a recursive application of the arithmetic expression rules, effectively allowing you to alter the precedence of operations. 4 times 2 is 8 (the use of parenthesis “trumps” the exponentiation operator, so the multiplication happens first); 8 ^ 3 is 512, minus 10 is 502.

trans-unit.source: Prior to the 1985 COBOL standard, using a period character was the only way to signal the end of a statement’s scope.

Prior to the COBOL2002 standard, source statements in COBOL programs were structured around 80-column punched cards. This means that each source line in a COBOL program consisted of five different “areas”, defined by their column number(s).
Procedural PERFORM Syntax
Procedure
Procedure name
Procedure names are optional in the procedure division and — when used — are named entirely according to the needs and whims of the programmer.
Procedure names may be up to thirty one (31) characters long and may consist of letters, numbers, dashes and underscores. A procedure name may neither begin nor end with a dash (‘

Procedure names may be up to thirty one (31) characters long and may consist of letters, numbers, dashes and underscores. A procedure name may neither begin nor end with a dash (-) or underscore (_) character. This means that "Main", "0100-Read-Transaction" and "17" are all perfectly valid procedure names.
trans-unit.target: Названия процедур могут содержать до тридцати одного (31)символа и могут состоять из букв,цифр,тире и знаков подчеркивания.Название процедуры не может начинаться или заканчиваться тире (-)или символом подчеркивания (_).Это означает,что "Main","0100-Read-Transaction" и "17" являются совершенно действительными названиями процедур.

trans-unit.source: Record
Record locked
Record overflow

Record-locking is supported by advanced file-management software built-in to the GnuCOBOL implementation you are using. This software provides a single point-of-control for access to files — usually ORGANIZATION INDEXED files. One such runtime package capable of doing this is the Berkeley Database (BDB) package — a package frequently used in GnuCOBOL builds to support indexed files.

Records in this type of file are all the same physical length, except possibly for the very last record in the file, which may be shorter than the others. If variable-length logical records are defined to the program, the space occupied by each physical record in the file will occupy the space described by the longest record description in the program.
trans-unit.target: Запись в этом типе файла имеет одинаковую физическую длину,за исключением,возможно,самой последней записи в файле,которая может быть короче остальных.Если программе заданы логические записи переменной длины,то пространство,занимаемое каждой физической записью в файле,будет занимать пространство,описанное самым длинным описанием записи в программе.

trans-unit.source: Records in this type of file are all the same physical length. If variable-length logical records are defined to the program, the space occupied by each physical record in the file will occupy the maximum possible space, and the logical record length field will contain the number of bytes of data in the record that are actually in use.
trans-unit.target: Записи в этом типе файлов имеют одинаковую физическую длину.Если программе заданы логические записи переменной длины,то пространство,занимаемое каждой физической записью в файле,будет занимать максимально возможное пространство,а поле логической длины записи будет содержать количество реально используемых байтов данных в записи.

trans-unit.source: Records must be read from or written to these files in a purely sequential manner. The only way to read (or write) record number 100 would be to have read (or written) records number 1 through 99 first.
trans-unit.target: Записи должны читаться из этих файлов или записываться в них чисто последовательно.Единственный способ прочитать (или записать)запись номер 100-это сначала прочитать (или записать)запись номеров с 1 по 99.

trans-unit.source: Referencing a BASED data item either before its storage has been allocated or after its storage has been released (via the FREE statement) will lead to “unpredictable results”. That’s how reference manuals and standards specifications talk about this situation. In the author’s experience, the results are all too predictable: the program aborts from an attempt to reference an unallocated area of memory.

Referencing aBASEDdata item either before its storage has been allocated or after its storage has been released (via theFREEstatement) will lead to "unpredictable results". That’s how reference manuals and standards specifications talk about this situation. In the author’s experience, the results are all too predictable — the program aborts from an attempt to reference an unallocated area of memory.
trans-unit.target: Ссылка на элемент данных BASED либо до того, как его хранилище было выделено, либо после того, как его хранилище было освобождено (через оператор FREE ), приведет к «непредсказуемым результатам». Вот как об этой ситуации говорят справочные руководства и спецификации стандартов. По опыту автора, результаты слишком предсказуемы - программа прерывает попытку ссылаться на нераспределенную область памяти.

Regardless of whether the compiler is operating in Fixed or Free Format Mode, GnuCOBOL allows alphanumeric literals to be broken up into separate fragments. These fragments have their own beginning and ending quote/apostrophe characters and are "glued together" at compilation time using "&"

Эти фрагменты имеют свои собственные начальные и конечные символы кавычек / апострофов и «склеиваются» во время компиляции с помощью символа «&».

Returned value :
Returned value as <var>argument-1</var> is assigned to a temporary boolean data item of usage bit described with the same number of boolean positions.

Returned value is a boolean item of usage bit that has the same bit configuration as the binary representation of the value of <var>argument-1</var>, where the rightmost boolean position is the low-order binary digit. The boolean value is zero-filled or truncated on the left, if necessary, in order to return a boolean item whose length is specified by <var>argument-2</var> in therms of boolean positions.

Returned values:

Returns the integer portion of <var>number</var> (a numeric literal or data item).
Returns the length — in bytes — of the specified string (a group item, USAGE DISPLAY elementary item or alphanumeric literal), minus the total number of trailing spaces, if any.
Returns the length — in characters — of string (a group item, USAGE DISPLAY elementary item or alphanumeric literal).
Returns: pid (the child process gets ’0’ returned, the calling process gets the pid of the created child).

Rounding is to the nearest value (larger or smaller). If two values are equally near, the value whose rightmost digit is
trans-unit.target: Округление до ближайшего значения (большего или меньшего).Если два значения равны по близости,то значение,крайняя правая цифра которого -

trans-unit.source: Rounding is to the nearest value (larger or smaller). If two values are equally near, the value with the larger absolute value is selected.
trans-unit.target: Округление до ближайшего значения (большего или меньшего).Если два значения одинаково близки,выбирается значение с большим абсолютным значением.

trans-unit.source: Rounding is to the nearest value (larger or smaller). If two values are equally near, the value with the smaller absolute value is selected.
trans-unit.target: Округление до ближайшего значения (большего или меньшего).Если два значения одинаково близки,выбирается значение с меньшим абсолютным значением.

trans-unit.source: Rounding is to the nearest value of larger magnitude.
trans-unit.target: Округление до ближайшего значения большей величины.

trans-unit.source: Rounding is to the nearest value whose magnitude is smaller.
trans-unit.target: Округление до ближайшего значения,чья величина меньше.

trans-unit.source: Rounding is toward the nearest value whose algebraic value is larger.
trans-unit.target: Округление производится по направлению к ближайшему значению,алгебраическое значение которого больше.

trans-unit.source: Rounding is toward the nearest value whose algebraic value is smaller.
trans-unit.target: Округление производится по направлению к ближайшему значению,алгебраическое значение которого меньше.

trans-unit.source: Rounding only applies when the result being saved to a receiving field with a ROUNDED clause is a non-integer value.
Rounding only applies when the result being saved to a receiving field with aROUNDEDclause is a non-integer value.
trans-unit.target: Округление применяется только в том случае, если результат, сохраняемый в поле приема с предложением ROUNDED , является нецелым значением.

Search strings on REPLACE are always specified using the ==pseudo-text-1== option. For example, to replace all occurrences of UPON PRINTER, you would specify ==UPON PRINTER==.

Similarly, since there is no END PROGRAM marker separating PROG3 from PROG2, it is possible for PROG3 to access GLOBAL files and data items defined within PROG2. Since PROG2 is nested within PROG1, any GLOBAL resources defined within PROG1 will be available to PROG3 as well.

Similarly, since there is noEND PROGRAMmarker separating PROG3 from PROG2, it is possible for PROG3 to accessGLOBALfiles and data items defined within PROG2. Since PROG2 is nested within PROG1, anyGLOBALresources defined within PROG1 will be available to PROG3 as well.
trans-unit.target: Аналогично, поскольку нет маркера END PROGRAM отделяющего PROG3 от PROG2, PROG3 может получить доступ к GLOBAL файлам и элементам данных, определенным в PROG2. Поскольку PROG2 вложен в PROG1, любые GLOBAL ресурсы, определенные в PROG1, также будут доступны для PROG3.

Simply stated, a Subprogram is a program that is invoked by another program; the subprogram performs whatever its designed operations are and — when complete — typically returns control back to the program that invoked it. There are two different types of subprograms supported by GnuCOBOL, subroutines and user-defined functions. The distinction between these two subprogram types lies in the manner in which they are executed.

trans-unit.source: Since the C program is planning on making changes to all three arguments, it declares all three as pointers in the function header and references the third argument as a pointer in the function body. It actually had no choice for the two string (char array) arguments — they must be defined as pointers in the function even though the function code references them without the leading ‘

Since the C program is planning on making changes to all three arguments, it declares all three as pointers in the function header and references the third argument as a pointer in the function body. It actually had no choice for the two string (char array) arguments – they must be defined as pointers in the function even though the function code references them without the leading * that normally signifies pointers.
trans-unit.target: Поскольку программа C планирует вносить изменения во все три аргумента, она объявляет все три как указатели в заголовке функции и ссылается на третий аргумент как указатель в теле функции. На самом деле у него не было выбора для двух строковых аргументов (массив символов) - они должны быть определены как указатели в функции, даже если код функции ссылается на них без начального символа «*», который обычно означает указатели.

trans-unit.source: Since the C program is the one that will execute first, before the GnuCOBOL subroutine, the burden of initializing the GnuCOBOL run-time environment lies with that C program; it will have to invoke the "cob_init" function, which is part of the "libcob" library. The two required C statements are shown highlighted.
trans-unit.target: Поскольку программа на Си будет выполняться первой,до подпрограммы GnuCOBOL,бремя инициализации среды исполнения GnuCOBOL лежит на этой программе на Си;она должна будет вызывать функцию "cob_init",которая является частью библиотеки "libcob".Два требуемых оператора Си показаны выделенными.

trans-unit.source: Since the C program is the one that will execute first, before the GnuCOBOL subroutine, the burden of initializing the GnuCOBOL run-time environment lies with that C program; it will have to invoke the cob_init function, which is part of the libcob library. The two required C statements are shown highlighted.

Since the C program wants to allow "arg3" to be changed by the subprogram, it prefixes it with a "&" to force a CALL BY REFERENCE for that argument. Since "arg1" and "arg2" are strings (char arrays), they are automatically passed by reference.
trans-unit.target: Поскольку программа на C хочет разрешить подпрограмме изменять аргумент «arg3», она ставит перед ним префикс «&», чтобы вызвать CALL BY REFERENCE для этого аргумента. Поскольку «arg1» и «arg2» являются строками (массивами символов), они автоматически передаются по ссылке.

Since the intent of a copybook is to introduce COBOL code into a particular spot in a program via the COPY statement (see COPY), it is always a good idea to prefix copybook names with a character sequence that identifies where in a program its contents are intended to be COPYed.

COPY ), всегда рекомендуется добавлять префикс к именам тетрадей с помощью последовательности символов, которая определяет, где в программе находится ее содержимое. предназначен для копирования.

So, if a file contains 1275 characters of data, and a program defines the structure of that file as containing 100-character records, then the file contents will consist of twelve (12) 100-character records with a final record containing only 75 characters.

trans-unit.source: Some COBOL implementations disallow the use of group items or PIC A items with NUMERIC class conditions and the use of PIC 9 items with ALPHABETIC class conditions. GnuCOBOL has no such restrictions.
Some COBOL implementations disallow the use of group items orPIC Aitems withNUMERICclass conditions and the use ofPIC 9items withALPHABETICclass conditions. GnuCOBOL has no such restrictions.
trans-unit.target: Некоторые реализации COBOL запрещают использование элементов группы или элементов PIC A с условиями класса NUMERIC и использование элементов PIC 9 с условиями класса ALPHABETIC . GnuCOBOL не имеет таких ограничений.

trans-unit.source: Some COBOL implementations provide this optional clause to force their sort and merge facilities to retain duplicate key-value records in their original input sequence, relative to one another.
trans-unit.target: Некоторые реализации COBOL предоставляют это необязательное условие для того,чтобы заставить их сортировать и объединять средства для сохранения дубликатов записей о значении ключа в их исходной входной последовательности,относительно друг друга.

trans-unit.source: Some COBOL statements have a

Some COBOL statements have a "scope of applicability" associated with them where one or more other statements can be considered to be part of or related to the statement in question. An example of such a situation might be the following, where the interest on a loan is being calculated and displayed — 4% interest if the loan balance is under $10000 and 4.5% otherwise (WARNING – the following code has an error!):
trans-unit.target: Некоторые операторы COBOL имеют связанную с ними «область применения», когда одно или несколько других операторов могут рассматриваться как часть рассматриваемого утверждения или связанные с ним. Примером такой ситуации может быть следующий, когда рассчитываются и отображаются проценты по кредиту - 4%, если остаток по кредиту меньше 10000 долларов, и 4,5% в противном случае (ВНИМАНИЕ - следующий код содержит ошибку!):

trans-unit.source: Some CPUs — such as the Intel/AMD i386/x64 architecture processors used in most Windows PCs — prefer to process binary data stored in a little-endian format. Since that format is more efficient on those systems, it is referred to as the

Some CPUs  such as the Intel/AMD i386/x64 architecture processors used in most Windows PCs  prefer to process binary data stored in a little-endian format. Since that format is more efficient on those systems, it is referred to as thenativebinary format.
trans-unit.target: Некоторые процессоры, такие как процессоры с архитектурой Intel / AMD i386 / x64, используемые в большинстве ПК с Windows, предпочитают обрабатывать двоичные данные, хранящиеся в формате little-endian. Поскольку этот формат более эффективен в этих системах, он называется native двоичным форматом.

trans-unit.source: Some may prefer to compile their GnuCOBOL main programs into these dynamically-loadable modules in the interests of using the same general compilation command for all programs without having to think "Is it a main program or a subprogram?".
trans-unit.target: Некоторые могут предпочесть скомпилировать свои основные программы GnuCOBOL в эти динамически загружаемые модули в интересах использования одной и той же общей команды компиляции для всех программ,не задумываясь:"Это основная программа или подпрограмма?".

trans-unit.source: Specification of an exception clause will allow your program to trap a failure condition that has occurred and handle it gracefully by executing imperative-statement-1 (see Imperative Statement). If such a condition occurs at runtime without having one of these clauses specified, an error message will be generated (by the GnuCOBOL runtime library) to the SYSERR device (pipe 2). The program may also be terminated, depending upon the type and severity of the error.

trans-unit.source: Specifying a LINAGE clause in an FD will cause the LINAGE-COUNTER special register to be created for the file. This automatically-created data item will always contain the current relative line number on the page being prepared which will serve as the starting point for a WRITE statement.

trans-unit.source: Subprogram

Subprogram "B" may be nested inside program "A" by including program B’s source code at the end of program A’s procedure division without an interveningEND PROGRAM A.orEND FUNCTION A.statement. For now, that’s all that will be said about nesting. See Independent vs Contained vs Nested Subprograms, for more information.
trans-unit.target: Подпрограммы «B» может быть вложенной программой внутри «А», включив в исходном коде программы В в в конце процедуры разделения программы А без промежуточной END PROGRAM A. или END FUNCTION A. заявления. На данный момент это все, что будет сказано о вложенности. Дополнительные сведения см. В разделе « Независимые против вложенных против вложенных подпрограмм» .

Subscripting
Subscripting is the process of referencing an element of a table utilizing either a numeric constant or an unedited numeric data item to select the desired occurrence.

Suggestion: use a copybook to describe the record layouts of any file; this guarantees that multiple programs accessing that file will "see" the same record sizes and layouts by coding aCOPYstatement (see COPY) to import the record layout(s) rather than hand-coding them.

trans-unit.source: Suggestion: use a copybook to describe the record layouts of any file; this guarantees that multiple programs accessing that file will “see” the same record sizes and layouts by coding a COPY statement (see COPY) to import the record layout(s) rather than hand-coding them.
Summary Report

Support for national character sets in GnuCOBOL is currently only partially implemented, and the compile- and run-time effect of using the N symbol in a PICTURE (see PICTURE) clause to define a field as containing national characters is the same as if X(2) had been coded, with the additional effect that such a field will qualify as a NATIONAL or NATIONAL-EDITED field on an INITIALIZE (see INITIALIZE) statement.

Support for national character sets in GnuCOBOL is currently only partially implemented, and the compile- and run-time effect of using theNsymbol in aPICTURE(see PICTURE) clause to define a field as containing national characters is the same as ifX(2)had been coded, with the additional effect that such a field will qualify as aNATIONALorNATIONAL-EDITEDfield on anINITIALIZE(see INITIALIZE) statement.
trans-unit.target: Поддержка национальных наборов символов в GnuCOBOL в настоящее время реализована только частично, а эффект компиляции и времени выполнения использования символа N в предложении PICTURE (см. PICTURE ) для определения поля как содержащего национальные символы такой же, как если бы X(2) было закодировано, с дополнительным эффектом, что такое поле будет квалифицироваться как поле NATIONAL или NATIONAL-EDITED в операторе INITIALIZE (см. INITIALIZE ).

trans-unit.source: Support for the ALTER verb has been added to GnuCOBOL for the purpose of enabling GnuCOBOL to pass those National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) tests for the COBOL programming language that require support for ALTER.

trans-unit.target: В GnuCOBOL добавлена поддержка команды ALTER , чтобы позволить GnuCOBOL пройти те тесты Национального института стандартов и технологий (NIST) для языка программирования COBOL, которые требуют поддержки ALTER .

The ACCESS MODE SEQUENTIAL clause is optional because, if absent, it will be assumed anyway for this type of file. The internal structure of these files is such that the data can only be processed in a sequential manner; in order to read the 100th record in such a file, for example, you first must read records 1 through 99.

The ACCESS MODE SEQUENTIAL clause is optional because, if absent, it will be assumed anyway for this type of file. The internal structure of these files is such that they can only be processed in a sequential manner; in order to read the 100th record in such a file, for example, you first must read records 1 through 99.
The ADVANCING PAGE clause will introduce an ASCII formfeed character into the file either before the written record (AFTER PAGE) or after the written record (BEFORE PAGE).
The AFTER EXCEPTION CONDITION and AFTER EC clauses are syntactically recognized but are otherwise non-functional.
The ALPHABET clause relates alphabet-name-1 to a specified character code set or collating sequence, including one you define yourself using the literal-1 option.

The ALTERNATE RECORD KEY clause, if used, defines an additional field within the record that provides an alternate means of directly accessing records or an additional field by which the file’s contents may be processed sequentially. You have the choice of allowing records to have duplicate alternate key values, if necessary.

The AUTHOR, DATE-COMPILED, DATE-MODIFIED, DATE-WRITTEN, INSTALLATION, REMARKS and SECURITY paragraphs are supported by GnuCOBOL only to provide compatibility with programs written for the ANS1974 (or earlier) standards. As of the ANS1985 standard, these clauses have become obsolete and should not be used in new programs.
The BLOCK CONTAINS, DATA RECORD, LABEL RECORD, RECORDING MODE and VALUE OF clauses are syntactically recognized but are obsolete and non-functional. These clauses should not be coded in new programs.

The CALL-CONVENTION clause allows a decimal integer, representing a series of ON/OFF switch settings, to be associated with a mnemonic name which may then be coded on a CALL statement (see CALL). The switch settings defined by this mnemonic will then control how the linkage to a subroutine invoked by the CALL statement that references mnemonic-name-1 will be handled.

The CODE-SET clause allows a custom alphabet, defined in the SPECIAL-NAMES (see SPECIAL-NAMES) paragraph, to be associated with a file. This clause is valid only when used with sequential or line sequential files.

The COLLATING SEQUENCE clause allows you to specify a customized character collating sequence to be used when alphanumeric values are compared to one another. Data will still be stored in the character set native to the computer, but the logical sequence in which characters are ordered for comparison purposes can be altered from that defined by the computer’s native character set. The alphabet-name-1 you specify needs to be defined in the SPECIAL-NAMES (see SPECIAL-NAMES) paragraph.
The COLLATING SEQUENCE, RECORD DELIMITER, RESERVE and ALL OTHER clauses are syntactically recognized but are otherwise non-functional.

The CONSOLE IS CRT clause, if specified, will cause a DISPLAY statement lacking an explicit UPON clause to be treated as a DISPLAY screen-data-item statement (see DISPLAY screen-data-item), and any ACCEPT statement lacking a FROM clause to be treated as a ACCEPT screen-data-item statement (see ACCEPT screen-data-item).
The CURRENCY SIGN clause may be used to redefine the character to be used as a currency sign in a PICTURE (see PICTURE) clause. The default currency sign is a dollar-sign (‘
The CURSOR IS clause allows you to specify a 4- or 6-character data item into which the cursor screen location at the time a screen ACCEPT is satisfied. The value will be returned as
The DEBUGGING MODE clause, if present, will inform the compiler that debugging lines (those with a ‘
The DECIMAL POINT IS COMMA clause reverses the definition of the ‘
The DEFINED option tests for whether cdf-variable-1 has been defined, but not yet assigned a value (>>DEFINE … OFF); use the NOT option to test for the variable not being defined.
The DELIMITED BY clause specifies how much of each source item will be copied into identifier-3. DELIMITED BY SIZE (the default if no DELIMITED BY clause is specified) causes the
The DUPLICATES clause is syntactically recognized but is otherwise non-functional.

The ESCAPE KEY option may be used after the ACCEPT FROM Screen-Info statement (see ACCEPT FROM Screen-Info) has executed. The result returned will be the four-digit CRT STATUS (see SPECIAL-NAMES) identifier value. See CRT STATUS Codes, for the specific code values.
The EVENT STATUS and SCREEN CONTROL clauses are syntactically recognized but are otherwise non-functional.

The FILE STATUS or SORT STATUS clause (they are both equivalent and only one or the other, if any, should be specified) is used to specify the name of a two-digit numeric data item into which an I/O status code will be saved after every I/O verb that is executed against the file. This does not actually allocate the data item — you must define the item yourself somewhere in the data division. Note that the following list is not definitive: more can be added and any tests should include one for non zeros as a catch all. Possible status codes that can be returned to a FILE STATUS data item are as follows:
The FIRST DETAIL clause defines the first line at which a detail group may be presented.
The FOLDCOPYNAME option provides the equivalent of specifying the compiler
The FOOTING clause defines the last line at which any line of a control footing group may be presented.
The FROM CRT, MODE IS BLOCK and CONVERSION clauses are syntactically recognized but are otherwise non-functional.
The HEADING clause defines the first line number at which a report heading or page heading may be presented.
The INITIAL clause, if specified, guarantees the subprogram will be in its initial (i.e. compiled) state each and every time it is executed, not just the first time.
The INPUT, OUTPUT, I-O and EXTEND open modes inform GnuCOBOL of the manner in which you wish to use the file, as follows:
The INTRINSIC clause allows you to flag one or more (or ALL) built-in intrinsic functions as being usable without the need to code the keyword FUNCTION in front of the function names.
The LAST CONTROLHEADING clause defines the last line at which any line of a control heading may be presented.
The LAST DETAIL clause defines the last line at which any line of a detail group may be presented.
The LINES and COLUMNS options will retrieve the respective components of the size of the console display.

The LOCALE clause may be used to associate external OS-defined locale names (literal-2) with an internal name (locale-name-1) that may then be referenced within the program. Locale names are defined by the Operating System and/or C compiler GnuCOBOL will be utilizing on your computer.
The LOCK clause defines how concurrent access to the file will be managed on a record-by-record basis. See Record Locking, for the details.
The MEMORY SIZE and SEGMENT-LIMIT clauses are syntactically recognized but are otherwise non-functional.
The NO ADVANCING clause, if used, will suppress the carriage-return / line-feed sequence that is normally added to the end of any console display.
The NO REWIND, and REVERSED clauses are syntactically recognized but are otherwise non-functional.
The NOFOLDCOPYNAME option turns off the effect of either the >>SET FOLDCOPYNAME statement or the compiler

The NUMERIC SIGN TRAILING SEPARATE specification causes all signed numeric USAGE DISPLAY data items to be created as if the SIGN IS TRAILING SEPARATE CHARACTER clause was included in their definitions.

The ON STATUS and OFF STATUS syntax provides a way of associating a condition-name with either the on or off status of the switch, so that status may be tested at execution time via the IF statement (see IF).

The OPTIONAL clause, to be used only for files that will be used to provide input data to the program, indicates the file may or may not actually be available at run-time. Attempts to OPEN an OPTIONAL file when the file does not exist will receive a special non-fatal file status value (see status 05 in the list of file status values below) indicating the file is not available; a subsequent attempt to READ that file will return an AT END (end-of-file) condition. Optionally, files may be designated as NOT OPTIONAL, if desired. This is useful when specifying the compiler’s

The OPTIONAL keyword, legal only on BY REFERENCE arguments, allows calling programs to code OMITTED for that corresponding argument when they call this subprogram. See CALL. for additional information on this feature.

The PARAMETER option is used to create a variable whose value is that of the environment variable of the same name. Note that this value assignment occurs at compilation time, not program execution time.
The POINTER data item — identifier-4 — must be a non-edited elementary integer numeric data item with a value greater than zero.

The RECORD CONTAINS and RECORD IS VARYING clauses are ignored (with a warning message issued) when used with line sequential files. With other file organizations, these mutually-exclusive clauses define the length of data records within the file. The data item specified as identifier-6 must be defined within one of the record descriptions of file-name-1.

The RECORD KEY clause defines the field within the record used to provide the primary access to records within the file. No two records in the file will be allowed to have the same PRIMARY KEY field value. The SOURCE IS clause is for use with Split Keys.

The RECURSIVE clause, if any, will cause the compiler to generate different object code for the subprogram that will enable it to invoke itself and to properly return back to the program that invoked it.

The REEL, LOCK and NO REWIND clauses are syntactically recognized but are otherwise non-functional, except for the CLOSE…NO REWIND statement, which will generate a file status of 07 rather than the usual 00 (but take no other action).
The RELATIVE KEY clause is optional only if ACCESS MODE SEQUENTIAL is specified.

The RELATIVE KEY data item is a numeric data item that cannot be defined as a field within records of this file. Its purpose is to return the current relative record number of a relative file that is being processed in SEQUENTIAL access mode and to serve as a key that specifies the relative record number to be read or written when processing a relative file in RANDOM access mode.

The REPORT IS clause announces to the compiler that the file will be dedicated to the Report Writer Control System (RWCS); the clause names one or more reports, each to be described in the report section. The following special rules apply when the REPORT clause is used:

The RETURNING clause allows you to specify a numeric data item into which the subroutine should return a numeric value. If you use this clause on the CALL, the subroutine should include a RETURNING (see PROCEDURE DIVISION RETURNING) clause on its procedure division header. Of course, a subroutine may pass a value of any kind back in any argument passed BY REFERENCE.
The RUN clause halts the program without displaying any special message to that effect.
The SAME SORT-MERGE and SAME SORT clauses are syntactically recognized but are otherwise non-functional.

The SCROLL option will cause the entire contents of the screen to be scrolled UP or DOWN by the specified number of lines before any value is displayed on the screen. It is syntactically allowable to specify a SCROLL UP clause as well as a SCROLL DOWN clause. In such an instance, it is the last one specified that will be honoured. If no LINES specification is made, 1 LINE will be assumed.
The SET option tests for whether cdf-variable-1 has been given a value, either via a >>SET statement or via a >>DEFINE without the OFF option.
The SHARING clause defines the conditions under which the program will be willing (or not) to allow other programs executing at the same time to access the file. See File Sharing, for the details.

The SHARING clause informs the GnuCOBOL file runtime modules how you are willing to co-exist with any other GnuCOBOL programs that may attempt to open the same file after your program does. See File Sharing, for an explanation of the SHARING clause.
The STATUS clause provides another means of returning an exit status. Using the STATUS clause is functionally equivalent to using the RETURNING clause.

The TIMEOUT option will cause the ACCEPT to wait no more than the specified number of seconds for input. The wait count may be specified as a positive integer or a numeric data item with a positive value.
The UPDATE option will enable the supplied data field to be updated having been displayed on screen prior to data being entered by overwriting, if needed. When this option is

The UPON CRT, UPON CRT-UNDER and CONVERSION clauses are syntactically recognized but are otherwise non-functional. They are supported to provide compatibility with COBOL source written for other COBOL implementations.
The USE AFTER STANDARD ERROR PROCEDURE clause defines a declarative procedure invoked any time a failure is encountered with the specified I/O type (or against the specified file(s)).

The USING clause defines a list of arguments that may be passed from the calling program to the subprogram. The manner in which any given argument is passed to the subroutine depends upon the BY clause (if any) coded (or implied) for that argument, as follows:

The USING clause defines the arguments the subroutine entry-point supports. This list of arguments must match up against the USING clause of any CALL statement that will be invoking the subroutine using this entry-point.
The USING clause should only be used on the procedure division header of subprograms (subroutines or user-defined functions).

The WITH LOCK option will be functional only if your GnuCOBOL build can support it. GnuCOBOL built for MinGW or native Windows will not, because the Unix fcntl primitive doesn’t exist in those environments. GnuCOBOL built for Cygwin or Unix will.
The perform scope is defined as being the statements within procedure-name-1, the statements within procedure-name-2 and all statements in all procedures defined between them.
The "-FSM-" acronyms make it easier to locate the description of the 01-item the status code and message text items belong to.
trans-unit.target: Сокращения "-FSM-" облегчают поиск описания 01-элемента,к которому относятся код статуса и текстовые элементы сообщения.

trans-unit.source: The "modern" languages, like Java, also have their own "boilerplate" infrastructure overhead that must be coded in order to write the logic that is necessary in the program. Take for example thepublic static void main(String[] arg)andimport java.util.Scanner;statements. The critics tend to forget about this when they criticize COBOL for it’s structural "overhead".
trans-unit.target: «Современные» языки, такие как Java, также имеют свои собственные «шаблонные» накладные расходы на инфраструктуру, которые необходимо закодировать для написания логики, необходимой в программе. Возьмем, к примеру, public static void main(String[] arg) и import java.util.Scanner; заявления. Критики обычно забывают об этом, когда критикуют COBOL за его структурные «накладные расходы».

trans-unit.source: The “-FSM-” acronyms make it easier to locate the description of the 01-item the status code and message text items belong to.

The “modern” languages, like Java, also have their own “boilerplate” infrastructure overhead that must be coded in order to write the logic that is necessary in the program. Take for example the public static void main(String[] arg) and import java.util.Scanner; statements. The critics tend to forget about this when they criticize COBOL for its structural “overhead”.
The ‘
The <
The ’
The -d debug flag is specified.

The ... meta character sequence signifies that the syntax element immediately preceding it may be repeated. The ... sequence itself should not be coded. If a syntax diagram contains a b... c, syntax element ‘

The ... meta character sequence signifies that the syntax element immediately preceding it may be repeated. The ... sequence itself should not be coded. If a syntax diagram containsa b... c syntax element "a" must be followed by at least one "b" element (possibly more) and the entire sequence must be terminated by a "c" syntax element.
trans-unit.target: Последовательность метасимволов ... означает, что элемент синтаксиса, непосредственно предшествующий ей, может повторяться. Сама последовательность ... не должна кодироваться. Если синтаксическая диаграмма содержит синтаксический элемент a b... c "a" должен следовать хотя бы один элемент "b" (возможно, больше), а вся последовательность должна завершаться синтаксическим элементом "c".

trans-unit.source: The 01-level constant is one of four types of compilation-time constants that can be declared within a program. The other three types are >>DEFINE CDF directive (see >>DEFINE) constants, >>SET CDF directive (see >>SET) constants and 78-level constants (see 78-Level Data Items).

The 01-level constant is one of four types of compilation-time constants that can be declared within a program. The other three types are>>DEFINECDF directive (see >>DEFINE) constants,>>SETCDF directive (see >>SET) constants and 78-level constants (see 78-Level Data Items).
trans-unit.target: Константа уровня 01 - это один из четырех типов констант времени компиляции, которые могут быть объявлены в программе. Остальные три типа: константы >>SET директивы >>DEFINE CDF (см. >> DEFINE ), >> константы директивы SET CDF (см. >> SET ) и константы 78-го уровня (см. Элементы данных 78-го уровня ).

trans-unit.source: The 1st and 2nd examples are referred to as Subscripting while the 3rd is known as Indexing. The distinction is fairly simple.
The 1st and 2nd examples are referred to as ’
The 7-character family of CPU products the CPU falls into. This will have values such as "A4", "A10", "Core i5", "Core i7", etc.
trans-unit.target: Семейство из 7-символьных продуктов,в которое входит процессор.Оно будет иметь такие значения,как "A4","A10","Core i5","Core i7" и др.

trans-unit.source: The 7-character family of CPU products the CPU falls into. This will have values such as “A4”, “A10”, “Core i5”, “Core i7”, etc.

The 78-level constant is one of four types of compilation-time constants that can be declared within a program. The other three types are >>DEFINE CDF directive (see >>DEFINE) constants, >>SET CDF directive (see >>SET) constants and 01-level constants (see 01-Level Constants).

The 78-level constant is one of four types of compilation-time constants that can be declared within a program. The other three types are>>DEFINECDF directive (see >>DEFINE) constants,>>SETCDF directive (see >>SET) constants and 01-level constants (see 01-Level Constants).
trans-unit.target: 78-уровневая константа - это один из четырех типов констант времени компиляции, которые могут быть объявлены в программе. Остальные три типа: константы >>SET директивы >>DEFINE CDF (см. >> DEFINE ), >> константы директивы SET CDF (см. >> SET ) и константы уровня 01 (см. Константы уровня 01 ).

trans-unit.source: The >>DEFINE CDF directive is one way to create CDF variables that may be processed by other CDF statements such as >>IF (see >>IF). The >>SET CDF directive (see >>SET) provides another way to create them.

The >>IF CDF directive causes the GnuCOBOL compiler to process or ignore COBOL source statements, CDF text-manipulation statements and/or CDF directives depending upon the value of one or more conditional expressions based upon CDF variables.
The >>LEAP-SECONDS CDF directive is syntactically recognized but is otherwise non-functional.
The >>SET CDF directive provides an alternate means of performing the actions of the >>DEFINE and >>SOURCE directives, as well as a means of controlling the compiler’s
The >>SOURCE CDF directive puts the compiler into FIXED or FREE source-code format mode. This, in effect, provides yet another mechanism for controlling the compiler’s
The <> symbol stands for NOT EQUAL TO.

The * operator computes the product of the left and right arguments while the / operator computes the value of the left argument divided by the value of the right argument. If the right argument has a value of zero, expression evaluation will be prematurely terminated before a value is generated. This may cause program failure at run-time.
The + operator calculates the sum of the left and right arguments while the - operator computes the value of the right argument subtracted from that of the left argument.

The device-name-1 IS mnemonic-name-2 clause allows you to specify an alternate name (device-name-1) for one of the built-in GnuCOBOL device name mnemonic-name-2. The list of device names built-into GnuCOBOL, and the physical device associated with that name, are as follows:

The feature-name-1 IS mnemonic-name-3 clause allow for mnemonic names to be assigned to up to the 13 printer channel (i.e. vertical page positioning) position feature names Cnn (nn=01-12) and CSP. Once a channel position has been assigned a mnemonic name, statements of the form WRITE record-name AFTER ADVANCING mnemonic-name-3 may be coded to write the specified print record at the channel position assigned to mnemonic-name-3.
The ACCEPT screen-data-item statement (see ACCEPT screen-data-item) will ignore the Enter key and any other cursor-moving keystrokes that would cause the cursor to move to another screen item

The ACCEPT screen-data-item statement (see ACCEPT screen-data-item) will ignore the Enter key and any other cursor-moving keystrokes that would cause the cursor to move to another screen item unless the proper amount of data has been entered into the field. Function keys will still be allowed to terminate the ACCEPT, however.
The ACOS function determines and returns the trigonometric arc-cosine, or inverse cosine, of cosine value (a numeric literal or data item) supplied as an argument.
The ADDRESS OF clause is optional and may be omitted. The presence or absence of this clause has no effect upon the program.

The ADVANCING PAGE clause will introduce the appropriate number of line-terminator character sequences into the file either before the written record (AFTER ADVANCING) or after the written record (BEFORE ADVANCING) so as to force the printer to automatically advance to a new sheet of paper when the file prints. No formfeed characters will be generated when LINAGE is specified — instead, it is assumed that the printer to which the report will be printed will be loaded with special forms that conform to the specifications defined by the LINAGE clause.

The ADVANCING n LINES clause will introduce the specified number of line-terminator character sequences into the file either before the written record (AFTER ADVANCING) or after the written record (BEFORE ADVANCING).
The ALLOCATE statement is used to dynamically allocate memory at run-time.
The ALPHABETIC-LOWER and ALPHABETIC-UPPER class conditions consider only spaces and the respective type of letters to be acceptable in order to pass such a class test.
The ALPHABETIC class test considers only upper-case letters, lower-case letters and spaces to be alphabetic in nature.

The ALTER statement was used in the early years of the COBOL language to edit the object code of a program at execution time, changing a GO TO (see Simple GO TO) statement to branch to a spot in the program different than where the GO TO statement was originally compiled for.
The ANY LENGTH and BASED (see BASED) clauses cannot be used together in the same data item description.
The ASIN function determines and returns the trigonometric arc-sine, or inverse sine, of sine value (a numeric literal or data item) supplied as an argument.

The AT END-OF-PAGE clause will be triggered, thus executing imperative-statement-1 (see Imperative Statement), if the WRITE statement introduces a data line or line-feed character into the file at a line position within the Page Footer area defined by the LINAGE clause. The NOT AT END-OF-PAGE clause will be triggered (thus executing imperative-statement-2) if no end-of-page condition occurred during the WRITE.

The AT END clause will — if present — cause imperative-statement-1 (see Imperative Statement) to be executed if the statement fails due to a file status of 10 (end-of-file). See File Status Codes, for a list of possible File Status codes.
The AUTO (see AUTO), AUTO-SKIP (see AUTO-SKIP) and AUTOTERMINATE clauses are interchangeable, and may not be used together in the same data item description.
The AUTO (see AUTO), AUTO-SKIP and AUTOTERMINATE (see AUTOTERMINATE) clauses are interchangeable, and may not be used together in the same data item description.
The AUTO, AUTO-SKIP (see AUTO-SKIP) and AUTOTERMINATE (see AUTOTERMINATE) clauses are interchangeable, and may not be used together in the same data item description.
The BASED and ANY LENGTH (see ANY LENGTH) clauses cannot be used together in the same data item description.
The BASED clause may only be used on level 01 and level 77 data items.
The BEEP (see BEEP) and BELL clauses are interchangeable, and may not be used together in the same data item description.
The BEEP and BELL (see BELL) clauses are interchangeable, and may not be used together in the same data item description.
The BLINK clause modifies the visual appearance of the displayed field by making the field contents blink.
The BY value, if any, will be added to identifier-2. If no BY is specified, it will be treated as if BY 1 had been specified.

The BYTE-LENGTH clause will produce a numeric value for constant-name-1 identical to that which would be returned by the BYTE-LENGTH intrinsic function executed against identifier-1 or a data item declared with a USAGE of usage-name.

The C$PRINTABLE subroutine converts the contents of the data-item specified as the first argument to printable characters. Those characters that are deemed printable (as defined by the character set used by data-item) will remain unchanged, while those that are NOT printable will be converted to the character specified as the second argument.
The CALL statement is used to transfer control to a subroutine. See Sub-Programming, for the specifics of using subprograms with GnuCOBOL programs.
The CANCEL statement unloads the dynamically-loadable subprogram module containing the entry-point specified as literal-1 or identifier-1 from memory.

The CBL_CLOSE_FILE subroutine closes a byte stream file previously opened by either the CBL_OPEN_FILE built-in system subroutine (see CBL_OPEN_FILE) or CBL_CREATE_FILE built-in system subroutine (see CBL_CREATE_FILE) subroutines.

The CBL_CREATE_FILE subroutine creates the new file specified using the file-path argument and opens it for output as a byte-stream file usable by CBL_WRITE_FILE built-in system subroutine (see CBL_WRITE_FILE).
The CBL_GC_PRINTABLE subroutine converts the contents of the data-item specified as the first argument to printable characters.

The CHAINING clause defines arguments that will be passed to a main program from the operating system. The argument identifiers specified on the CHAINING clause will be populated by character strings comprised of the parameters specified to the program on the command line that executed it, as follows:
The CHAINING term provides one mechanism a programmer may use to retrieve command-line arguments passed to a program at execution time.
The CHARACTERS option will match any one single character, regardless of what that character is.
The CHARACTERS option will match any one single character. When you use this option, the replacement sub string (see the next item) must be exactly one character in length.
The CLOSE statement may only be executed against files that have been successfully opened.
The CLOSE statement terminates the program’s access to the specified file(s).
The COLUMN clause provides the means of stating in which column a field should be presented on the console window (screen section) or a report (report section).
The COMMIT statement performs an UNLOCK against every currently-open file, but does not close any of the files. See the UNLOCK statement (see UNLOCK) for additional details.
The COMPUTE (see COMPUTE) statement will evaluate the arithmetic expression C-D+1 and then save that result in I.

The COMPUTE statement provides a means of easily performing complex arithmetic operations with a single statement, instead of using cumbersome and possibly confusing sequences of ADD, SUBTRACT, MULTIPLY and DIVIDE statements. COMPUTE also allows the use of exponentiation — an arithmetic operation for which no other statement exists in COBOL.
The COMPUTE statement supports exponentiation (via the ‘

The CONSTANT option is valid only in conjunction with literal-1. When CONSTANT is specified, the CDF variable that is created may be used within your regular COBOL code as if it were a literal value. Without this option, the CDF variable may only be referenced on other CDF statements. The OFF option is used to create a variable without assigning it any value.
The CONTINUE statement has no effect on the execution of the program.
The CONTINUE statement is a no-operation statement that may be coded anywhere an imperative statement (see Imperative Statement) may be coded.
The CONTROL FOOTING and CONTROL HEADING report groups will be presented in the sequence in which they are listed on the CONTROL clause.

The CONVERTING clause replaces one or more individual characters found in the inspect subject with a different character in much the same manner as is possible with the TRANSFORM statement (see TRANSFORM).
The COPY statement is case-sensitive on UNIX systems; COPY copybookname and COPY COPYBOOKNAME will both fail to locate the CopyBookName copybook on a UNIX system.
The COS function determines and returns the trigonometric cosine of angle (a numeric literal or data item) supplied as an argument.
The CR symbol is not allowed in conjunction with ‘
The CSP positioning option stands for “No Spacing”. Testing on a MinGW build of GnuCOBOL shows that this too results in a formfeed being issued.

The CURRENCY-SYMBOL function returns the currency symbol character currently in effect for the locale under which your program is running. On UNIX systems, your locale is established via the LANG run-time environment variable (see Run Time Environment Variables) environment variable. On Windows, the Control Panel’s "Regional and Language Options" define the locale.
The Char-Value item now has the corresponding ASCII character value.
The DB symbol is not allowed in conjunction with ‘

The DECLARATIVES area of the procedure division allows the programmer to define a series of “trap” procedures (referred to as declarative procedures) capable of intercepting certain events that may occur at program execution time. The syntax diagram above shows the format of a single such procedure.
The DELETE statement logically deletes a record from a COBOL file.
The DETAIL group which is defined for report-name-1
The EMPTY-CHECK (see EMPTY-CHECK) and REQUIRED clauses are interchangeable, and may not be used together in the same data item description.
The EMPTY-CHECK and REQUIRED (see REQUIRED) clauses are interchangeable, and may not be used together in the same data item description.
The END PROGRAM PROG1. marker, since it is the last line in the source file, is entirely optional.
The ENTRY statement is used to define an alternate entry-point into a subroutine, along with the arguments that subroutine will be expecting.
The EVALUATE statement provides a means of defining processing that should take place under any number of mutually-exclusive conditions.
The EXIT FUNCTION statement cannot be used anywhere within a subroutine.
The EXIT PERFORM and EXIT PERFORM CYCLE statements are intended to be used in conjunction with an in-line PERFORM statement (see Inline PERFORM).

The EXIT PROGRAM and EXIT FUNCTION statements terminate the execution of a subroutine (i.e. a program that has been CALLed by another) or user-defined function, respectively, returning control back to the calling program.
The EXIT PROGRAM statement is not legal anywhere within a user-defined function.

The EXIT statement is a multi-purpose statement; it may provide a common end point for a series of procedures, exit an in-line PERFORM, paragraph or section or it may mark the logical end of a subprogram, returning control back to the calling program.
The EXTERNAL clause may only be specified at the 77 or 01 level.

The Employee data item consists of two subordinate data items — an Employee-Name and an Employment-Dates data item (presumably there would be a lot of others too, but we don’t care about them right now). As the diagram shows, each of those data items are, in turn, broken down into subordinate data items. This hierarchy of data items can get rather deep, and GnuCOBOL, like other COBOL implementations, can handle up to 49 levels of such hierarchical structures.
The FD cannot be followed by record descriptions. Detailed descriptions of data to be printed to the file will be defined in the REPORT SECTION (see REPORT SECTION).

The FOREVER option will repeatedly execute the code within the perform scope with no conditions defined for termination of the repetition — it will be up to the programmer to include an EXIT SECTION statement (see EXIT) or EXIT PARAGRAPH statement within the procedure(s) being performed that will break out of the loop.
The FREE statement releases memory previously allocated to the program by the ALLOCATE statement (see ALLOCATE).
The FROM (see FROM), TO (see TO), USING (see USING) and VALUE clauses are mutually-exclusive in any screen section data item’s definition.
The FROM (see FROM), TO (see TO), USING and VALUE (see VALUE) clauses are mutually-exclusive in any screen section data item’s definition.
The FROM (see FROM), TO, USING (see USING) and VALUE (see VALUE) clauses are mutually-exclusive in any screen section data item’s definition.
The FROM, TO (see TO), USING (see USING) and VALUE (see VALUE) clauses are mutually-exclusive in any screen section data item’s definition.
The FULL (see FULL) and LENGTH-CHECK clauses are interchangeable, and may not be used together in the same data item description.
The FULL and LENGTH-CHECK (see LENGTH-CHECK) clauses are interchangeable, and may not be used together in the same data item description.
